DESCRIPTOR.STUDY_TITLE: H3K4me3 and H3K36me3 modifications in Arabidopsis mutants for pirin2 and hub2
DESCRIPTOR.STUDY_ABSTRACT: The abundancies of Histone H3 Lysine 4 trimethylation (H3K4me3) and H3K36me3 were analysed by Chromatin immunoprecipitation and DNA sequencing in Arabidopsis thaliana hypocotyls. The assays were performed in two different genotypes; a knock-out mutant (SM_3.15394) for the PIRIN2 gene (At2g43120) and a knock-out mutant (GABI_634H04) for the Histone H2B MONOUBIQUITINATION 2 (HUB2; At1g55250). Three biological replicates, each consisting of a large pool of hypocotyls, was assayed for each genotype. Hypocotyls were collected from 6 weeks SD (short days) + 4 weeks LD (long days) grown plants and cross-linked immediately in 1% formaldehyde. Chromatin preparation and Immunoprecipitation were performed by standard procedures. Library construction and DNA sequencing was performed by Beijing Genome Institute. Bioinformatic analyses were performed in house.
